com.noctarius.tengi.spi.serialization

Interface Protocol

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DebuggableProtocol

    public interface Protocol

    The Protocol interface describes a common wire-protocol for object translation. It handles writing and translation of type-ids as well as the common contract for nullable and non-nullable objects.

    In addition, protocols normally take care of registered Marshallers and type registration.

    • Method Detail

      • getMimeType

        String getMimeType()
        Returns the mime-type of the Protocol for HTTP based protocols.
        Returns:
        the protocol's mime-type

      • writeTypeId

        void writeTypeId(Object value,
                 Encoder encoder)
        Writes the type-id of the given object to the encoder. The default protocol uses the type short for type-ids but other protocols are free to use any other type.
        Parameters:
        value - the value of which the type-id will be written
        encoder - the Encoder to write the type-id to

      • readTypeId

        <T> Class<T> readTypeId(Decoder decoder)

        Resolves the next type-id in the stream (represented by the Decoder) to a class. If the class cannot be found an ClassNotFoundException is thrown.

        The default protocol uses the type short for type-ids but other protocols are free to use any other type.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the following up element
        Parameters:
        decoder - the Decoder to read the type-id from
        Returns:
        the class of the following up type

      • readTypeObject

        <T> T readTypeObject(Decoder decoder)

        Resolves the next type-id in the stream (represented by the Decoder) to a class first and then tries to instantiate it. This can be used from Marshaller implementations to first create an instance of the following up element and then read back in the values.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the following up element
        Parameters:
        decoder - the Decoder to read the type-id from
        Returns:
        the instance of the following up type

      • readObject

        <O> O readObject(String fieldName,
                 Decoder decoder)
          throws Exception

        Reads the content of a non-null object from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The content itself will be deserialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to read a type tag for the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might have decided to write the value to the stream but this is not required.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to write
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field to be read, strictly for debugging purpose only
        decoder - the Decoder to read the object from
        Returns:
        the non-null object value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • writeObject

        <O> void writeObject(String fieldName,
                     O object,
                     Encoder encoder)
              throws Exception

        Transfers a non-null object to the underlying byte-stream buffer. The content itself will be serialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to tag the type of the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might decide to write the value to the stream but is not required to.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to write
        Parameters:
        object - the object value to be written to the buffer
        fieldName - the name of the field to be written, strictly for debugging purpose only
        encoder - the Encoder to write the object to
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements
        NullPointerException - whenever the given object is null
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • writeNullable

        default <O> void writeNullable(O object,
                               Encoder encoder,
                               MarshallerWriter<O> writer)
                        throws Exception

        Transfers a nullable object to the underlying byte-stream buffer. A marker bit is written to the stream to identify the object was null or actual object content is about to follow up. The content itself will be serialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to tag the type of the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might decide to write the value to the stream but is not required to.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to write
        Parameters:
        object - the object value to be written to the buffer
        encoder - the Encoder to write to
        writer - the MarshallerWriter to write the object's content
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • readNullable

        default <O> O readNullable(Decoder decoder,
                           MarshallerReader<O> reader)
                    throws Exception

        Reads the content of a nullable object from the underlying byte-stream buffer. A marker bit is read from the stream to identify the object was null or actual object content is about to follow up. The content itself will be deserialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to read a type tag for the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to read
        Parameters:
        decoder - the Decoder to read the object from
        reader - the MarshallerReader to read the object's content
        Returns:
        the an object value read from the buffer or null
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • writeNullable

        default <O> void writeNullable(String fieldName,
                               O object,
                               Encoder encoder,
                               MarshallerWriter<O> writer)
                        throws Exception

        Transfers a nullable object to the underlying byte-stream buffer. A marker bit is written to the stream to identify the object was null or actual object content is about to follow up. The content itself will be serialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to tag the type of the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to store all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might decide to write the value to the stream but is not required to.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to write
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field to be written, strictly for debugging purpose only
        object - the object value to be written to the buffer
        encoder - the Encoder to write to
        writer - the MarshallerWriter to write the object's content
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to store all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • readNullable

        default <O> O readNullable(String fieldName,
                           Decoder decoder,
                           MarshallerReader<O> reader)
                    throws Exception

        Reads the content of a nullable object from the underlying byte-stream buffer. A marker bit is read from the stream to identify the object was null or actual object content is about to follow up. The content itself will be deserialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to read a type tag for the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might have decided to write the value to the stream but this is not required.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to read
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field to be read, strictly for debugging purpose only
        decoder - the Decoder to read the object from
        reader - the MarshallerReader to read the object's content
        Returns:
        the an object value read from the buffer or null
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs
